intro: Alsine verna lusus micropetala, commonly known as the small-petalled yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. It has a low-growing habit with branching stems and is often found in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a hardy and adaptable species within its native range.
